channel.title: Rrecommendations for Network Tools
channel.description:
Hi there, I recently got employed (first job) as a sysadmin and netadmin at a small company and I was wondering what networking and/or administrative tools I could use that they can help me at my job.
Currently I am using Wireshark to monitor the network and Nmap to check out the machines. Are there any other tools you would recommend that are helpful?

item.title: Rrecommendations for Network Tools
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Rrecommendations for Network Tools
item.dc:creator: Shellsquid
item.description:
That probably largely depends on what kind of network you operate. But in general I’d think the whole range of

snmpwalk & snmpget

And the like can be useful.

There are a lot of very specific tools that all serve their purpose well but there will be a lot you won’t need as they’re irrelevant for your network.

• Is it just a normal office environment?
• What OS are used in the network? Which do you use yourself?
• Are you also responsible for network security?

Knowing this would likely help to answer your question better.

Read full topic
